newsitem.title: USA: FORD TO RECALL SOME WINDSTARS, TAURUS AND SABLES.
newsitem.headline: FORD TO RECALL SOME WINDSTARS, TAURUS AND SABLES.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Thursday it is making a safety recall of 63,500 1997 and 1998 Windstar minivans and 47,300 1997 Taurus and Sable cars.

The vehicles, which contain AX4S automatic transaxles, are being recalled because the transaxle servo cover may fracture and result in the loss of transmission fluid on some vehicles, the automaker said.

The loss of fluid may cause the transmission to disengage, causing the vehicle to coast to a stop, the company said. In some cases, the fluid could contact the catalytic converter, creating the risk of fire. However, no fires have been reported, Ford said.
Of the vehicles being recalled, 9,000 Windstars and 1,600 of the Tauruses and Sables are located in Canada, the company said.
The Windstar is manufacturered in Oakville, Ontario, and the Taurus and Sable are manufactured in both Chicago and Atlanta.
